description: Borrowed from Middle French imperceptible, from Medieval Latin imperceptibilis.

adjectives.description: imperceptible (comparative more imperceptible, superlative most imperceptible)

entries.meaning: not perceptible, not detectable, too small in magnitude to be observed
examples: We all missed the imperceptible shake of his head as he tried to warn us without being seen.

entries.meaning: beyond the purview of man; too great and all-encompassing to be perceived.
